meanings.definition: The state or quality of being first.
meanings.sent1: Her firstness in the race was evident from the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The firstness of the sunrise brought a sense of new beginnings.
meanings.sent3: The firstness of the baby's cry filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: His firstness in solving the puzzle amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The firstness of the champion was undeniable.

meanings.definition: The act of being the first in order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The firstness of his arrival surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: In the firstness of the line, she eagerly waited for her turn.
meanings.sent3: The firstness of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His firstness in reaching the summit was a moment of pride.
meanings.sent5: The firstness of the announcement caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The position of being ahead of all others in time or space.
meanings.sent1: The firstness of the spaceship's launch was a historic moment.
meanings.sent2: In the firstness of the room, she found a cozy spot by the window.
meanings.sent3: The firstness of the comet's appearance was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His firstness in the race was a result of dedicated training.
meanings.sent5: The firstness of the discovery marked a new era in science.
